name: HB Custom Biotics carillion v1.0
Corporate Games v.0.01
description:
Overview: A first attempt at making a Android Netrunner deck, with a emphasis on running on HQ and accessing multiple cards for stealing agendas or information gathering for future runs. Laramy Fisk was chosen due to his identity ability which lets us dredge through R&D to trash potentially harmful or inconvenient cards, gather further information on upcoming plays, and to acquire lurking agendas. To help accomplish successful runs I tried to run a reliable suite of Icebreaker's to combat any possible contingency of ice that may be encountered and at the same time have a integrated economy that works from successful runs. This is possible from Djinn's Tutoring ability to find both Datasucker and Pheromones which will both help to 1.) Reduce costs of breaking protecting ice 2.) Provide a recurring buffer of money to be used during runs 3.) To have the Corporation waste occasional turns on clearing virus tokens to attempt to check our icebreaker's potential breaking power. I also included a suite of non program economy: Kati Jones, Easy Mark, Daily Casts, Account Siphon and Desperado to help combat any potential lock outs the runner may come across due to Djinn and attached programs being trashed or impeding ice that cannot be overcome in the short term.

Potential Issues: Deck appears to have issues with running remote servers from having only 2 copies of Knight and 2 copies of Femme Fatale to stop any large strength ice and code gates. Also suffers from a lack of program recursion so possible runs might become more complicated as icebreakers become trashed. Finally, since all the deck's fighting potential relies on icebreakers it can fail to get through particular pieces of Ice.

Comments on improving deck synergy and/or play-ability is welcomed and appreciated.

name: Clickfcuk v2.0
description:
Based both on my original Clickfcuk deck and especially a deck by Run Last Click's Eady called Superfriends (here: http://runlastclick.blogspot.com/2014/06/deckslists-super-friends.html#more), I wanted to try an all asset economy on top my deck which was all about gaining clicks. I actually wanted to add more click loss into it too (False Lead, Enigma, Bioroid ICE) but that never works out. I'm hoping this works out.

And before you say it, I really do like having 3 Sub Messagings in here. It's a great way to fill your hand up with extra stuff to toss and to get free money, which is nice and works with the theme (though if anything is going to go for ice, it might be them).

name: Whizzard Chessmaster 2 (1st place Regional Liège Belgium)
description: Deck by Sander Vernyns. Read more on BGG.

name: kate in the red dress
description: parasite kate with a twist: connections. link works wonders against tracers (which is what nbn is about really). try to run only when WitRD says it's worth it. clickless economy is always good and helps with costly atman runs.

name: Tutorial Corp Deck
description: Trying to teach the player about ice and stuff. You know how it is.

name: Tagged Grid 2.0
description:
I always prefer playing runner side and i always have dificulty designing corp decks. This is my attempt to make a NBN tag deck that has also some fast advance capability.

Suggestions appreciated :)

name: Blood Money
description:
This is my other corp deck. A strong economy driven Weyland that tries do mount a super server for scoring agendas.

I'm still reluctant about some of these options, though...

name: Tagged Grid 3.0
description:
I always prefer playing runner side and i always have dificulty designing corp decks. This is my attempt to make a NBN tag deck that has also some fast advance capability.

Made some changes after wswan suggestions: Included Elizabeth Mills to deal with Muckraker's bad pub and i've also modified my ice's roster to include some more barriers.

Suggestions appreciated :)

name: Virus Delivery
Dumpster Diving
I got the runs
description: Only major downside is if they install really fast on remotes but if that happens account siphon a few times or follow one up with a vamp then run the remote they can't rez ice on

name: The executioners seat: MK1
description:
I've been experimenting with advancable Wayland for a longtime now, and this is by far the best build that I've tested.

Originally the deck was supposed to have 2x mid-seasons and 2x psychographics, but due to jackson howards ability to hide my already scarce agendas I had to remove one of the psychographics to free influence.

As for the ice I try to use the small Ice for protection from inside jobs and other such things that can attack a server in that way, but the ice walls and hadrians will always see 15+ advancements by mid game.

Also somethings that has caught some people off guard is a psycho graphics on a woodcutter usually ending the game as it sits behind a devastatingly advanced icewall or hadrianss to tax he runner out of breaking more than 6 subroutines on the woodcutter.

All that with some scorches and I am very pleased with this build as a whole.

(ps. I haven't included it yet as I will be taking this deck around before it will be released, but I will replace Simone Diago with the root as soon as I get my hands on it :p)

name: House ot the rising SanSan
description:
Not much to see here. I took this deck to the Italian Regional and it earned me a 10th place, nothing to write home about. I blame the mediocre performance on my lack of skill, the strenght of my opponents, being too formulaic in playing the deck and misreading the game's state. It is derived from Fastrobiotics, changing some ice around to taxing. The deck however performed how it was supposed to be: sufficient ice to defend centrals lightly, a little economy to get you started, click for credits while digging for Biotic / Fast Track. Psychic FIeld never failed to defend SanSan and / or slow down a runner trashing breaker from hands, it's main purpose.
Here i present you some Netrunner entertainment.
Sung on the tune of House of the rising Sun

House of the rising SanSan

There is a house, a damn upgrade
They call the grid SanSan
And it's been the ruin of many a poor runner
And God I know I'm one

That server was 2-ice deep
Inside Job would not get in
The Corp was The N-B-N
Woe, fear the Astro-train !

Now the only things a runner needs
Are credits and a rig
And the only time a Corp can score
Is when he's all-out broke

[Organ Solo]

Oh runners, tell your Risties
Not to do what I have done
Spend your clicks and Dirty Laundries
to trash unrezzed SanSans

Five creds to trash the upgrade
Five creds to stop the train
I'm goin' broke and penniless
To play a dumb Psi-game

Well, there is a house, a damn upgrade
They call the grid SanSan
And it's been the ruin of many a poor runner
And God I know I'm one

name: Hey Gabe, Take a run on the last click
description:
Not much to see here. I took this deck to the Italian Regional and it earned me a 10th place, nothing to write home about. I blame the mediocre performance on my lack of skill, the strenght of my opponents, being too formulaic in playing the deck and misreading the game's state. And i got caught up in Gabe' awesome playstyle, facecheck everything and run like there's no tomorrow. I had put in three safety-blankets, the economic resources, to force me into a slower pace, but ended up ignoring them almost every game. I dearly regreted not including Emergency SHutdowns.
Here i present you some Netrunner entertainment.
Inspired by the Podcast Run Last CLick
Sung on the tune of Walk on the Wild Side

"Run on the last click"

Rielle came from out of nowhere
Hitch-hiked the Beanstalk down to earth.
Plugged her brains up the net
Asked Herself "ICE wants to be free ?"
She says, "Hey, Gabe,
Take a run on the last click."
Said, "Hey, Noise,
Take a run on the last click."

Andy came from the High-and-Mighty
In the tourney she left everybody pouty
Cause she never lost her hand
Really great start of an hand
She says, "Hey, Gabe,
Take a run on the last click."
Said, "Hey, Kate,
Take a run on the last click."
And the corp execs go
"Doo do doo do doo do do doo..."

Reina Ro never gave you a break
Every rez you had a cred to pay
A Siphon here and a Siphon there
SanSan City's the place
Where they said, "Hey, Gabe,
Take a run on the last click."
I said, "Hey, Ro,
Take a run on the last click."

Little Chaos Theory came and hit the streets
Looking for some new friend to play with
Then she built a Dinobot
You should've seen them romp, romp, romp
They said, "Hey, Theory,
Take a run on the last click."
I said, "Hey, Gabe,
Take a run on the last click."
All right, huh

Exile is just wasting away
Sat on bench moping all the day
But at night, picking trash
He would spank you with streetchess
Said, "Hey, Gabe,
Take a run on the last click."
I said, "Hey, Noise,
Take a run on the last click."
And the corp execs say,
"Doo do doo do doo do do doo..."

name: Ghost Buster
description:
This deck really wants Paintbrush to function, but I haven't pick up Double Time yet. Ideally pressure on servers to rez 6 pieces of ice (HQ, R&D, Scoring remote) will be enough. The Knights force the serves to be three or even four deep, which is very taxing. The Emergency Shutdowns are there to promote cheaper runs once you can get into HQ, but I'm wondering if Sneakdoor Beta would be a stronger splash.

Ideally you never install Creeper and Inti but they are there just in case.

name: Blackgabe
description:
My latest effort in making a competitive Blackguard-Snitch deck.

Feedback appreciated!!

name: White Hot Ash
description: My latest RP build. I know there's a lot of RP talk on here already, but feedback is appreciated. Thinking I might be light on econ?

name: Wyrm Food
description:
Just a fun idea I've been toying around with. In theory you should be able to kill most ice you encounter as soon as you encounter it provided you have:

a) SMC + 4 credits and a parasite in stack

b) Clone chip + 2 credits and parasite in heap

c) 2 credits + Parasite on PW

install parasite upon rez (prior to encounter), let Nasir's ability proc, and let wyrm do its thing. Naked Wyrm + toolbox can kill most things. 3x Personal touched wyrm + toolbox is stopped only by Archer (hence sharpshooter). Basic breaker suite included for flexibility.

Deja vu + SOT recurs up to 10 parasites for up to 13 ICE killed.

Clone chips, SMC, Test Runs are there to tutor for rig pieces as needed.

Current build goes for R&D lock. Could exchange a parasite for a Nerve Agent or Djinn to improve flexibility.

I'm also considering a variant with Underworld Contacts to potentially streamline the ice-destruction process.

name: Off the Grid Jinteki Thought Experiment
description:
I am aware this is not a great deck, but my real goal is to get some suggestions of where to take it and try to inspire some conversation on the whole subject, so stay with me best you can on this.

As a bit of background when I first met one of the guys I played with we both found some fondness for Off the Grid. An impractical card yes, but we thought it would be fun to try to build a deck around it.

The obvious choice is HB to get a nice, big server over HQ and with Oversight AI and Bioroid Efficiency Research it would be trivial to get some big hitters up quickly, but we thought that a bit played. One of the problems with Off the Grid is iceing up HQ heavily is that leaves R&D lock a pretty big problem. So, our thought was to bring it to Jinteki for the internal R&D traps to help lessen that problem.

As a side benefit we would also have Caprice Nisei in faction such that even if all of the ice was broken, there is still that chance of pulling out an unsucessful HQ run. Add to that the amount of incredibly taxing ice (since this is a slower deck cheap end the runs were not favorable) Jinteki has access to after Honor and Profit, along with the control ice that is Bullfrog and Susanoo-No-Mikoto and we thought we would have a little bit of synergy going on. With the amount of Psi going on, Nisei division seemed to be an alright choice, though we are always open to Personal Evolution to get that extra bit of killing open. And we were also thinking about how some of Jinteki's ice stacks really well with Chum and whatnot, and gave Sunset a chance for our positioned mega-server.

One of the thought processes that goes on with Off the Grid is what's so important that it has to be protected in such a way, and we felt maybe Chairman Hiro such that even getting though the big server we planned, the runner wouldn't have the money to trash. Then, recure with Interns and/or Jackson Howard.

So those are our general thoughts. I know this deck is not great, but I'm interested to see what people have to say on the subject, just to get some gears turning. It'll never be compeditive, but sure could be fun or at the very least interesting
